intro: Dipladenia oblongifolia, commonly known as the oblong-leaf trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant orange to red tubular flowers. The leaves are elongated and slightly heart-shaped, with a smooth texture. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-draining soil and full sun exposure. This plant is often cultivated as a decorative vine due to its showy blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
